src:
סין: הושגה הסכמה עקרונית עם ארה"ב סביב סוגיות הסחר
זאת לאחר שיחת טלפון בדרג גבוה שקיימו הצדדים - בין סגן הנשיא ליו ונציג הסחר לייטייזר ושר האוצר מנוצ'ין; לפי משרד הסחר הסיני, הצדדים ערכו "דיונים רציניים וחיוביים"
02 Nov 2019 by שירות כלכליסט
סין הודיעה אתמול (ו') שהגיעה להסכמה עקרונית עם ארה"ב סביב סוגיית מלחמת הסחר - זאת לאחר שיחת טלפון בדרג גבוה שקיימו צוותי המשא ומתן השבוע.
משרד המסחר הסיני מסר שסגן הנשיא ליו הי קיים אתמול שיחת טלפון עם נציג הסחר האמריקאי רוברט לייטיזר ועם שר האוצר סטיבן מנוצ'ין. לדבריו, שני הצדדים ערכו "דיונים רציניים וחיוביים" על נושאי ליבה בסכסוך הסחר, וכן על הפרטים הטכניים של סבב השיחות הבא.


מימין: לייטיייזר וליו צילום: רויטרס

הבית הלבן מסר אתמול שנציגי הסחר "השיגו התקדמות בכמה נושאים ונמצאים בתהליך ליבון נושאים נוספים. הדיונים ימשיכו ברמת סגני שר".
בחודש שעבר הגיעו ארה"ב וסין להפסקת אש במלחמת הסחר ביניהן והחלו לעבוד על סיכום הסכם סחר מ"שלב ראשון" שכולל הפסקה של הטלת מכסים, וכן רכישה של מוצרים חקלאיים אמריקאיים ע"י סין. הנשיא טראמפ אמר ביום חמישי שבקרוב יפורסם המקום בו ייחתם הסכם השלב הראשון לאחר שצ'ילה ביטלה פסגה שהייתה אמורה להתקיים בשטחה, עקב המהומות שפוקדות את המדינה.
טראמפ אמר גם שההסכם הראשון מכסה 60% מההסכם הסופי העתידי. עם זאת, ביום חמישי דווח שסין ספקנית לגבי הגעה להסכם כולל עקב "טבעו האימפולסיבי" של טראמפ. לארי קודלו, יועצו הכלכלי של טראמפ, אמר לרשת פוקס אתמול ששתי המדינות טרם השלימו את הדיונים בעניין גניבת קניין רוחני על ידי סין. הוא הוסיף שנושאי השירותים הפיננסיים והמטבע שבהסכם "הגיעו למעשה לפיתרון".
גורמים רבים בוול סטריט הביעו ספקנות לגבי הסכם השלב הראשון, כיוון שלדעתם הוא מכסה חלק קטן בלבד מהנושאים שטראמפ הצהיר שבכוונתו לפתור.
text:
Bethlehem residents celebrate the start of the traditional annual olive festival

02 Nov 2019

The 19th annual traditional olive festival, organized by the Bethlehem Municipality's Peace Center and the Environmental Education Center of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Jordan and the Holy Land, was held under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Ramallah. Mohammed Shtayyeh, in cooperation with the Ministry of Agriculture, Bethlehem Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Union of Agricultural Work Committees, and Agricultural Relief. The 19th Olive Harvest Festival, which was held in the Nativity Square, was attended by the Governor of Bethlehem Kamel Hameed, the Minister of Agriculture Riad Al-Attari, the Deputy Mayor of Bethlehem Hanna Hanania, and Bishop Sunny Ibrahim Azar, President of the Evangelical Lutheran Church. Jordan and the Holy Land, Simon Awad, Executive Director of the Center for Environmental Education, Commander of Bethlehem Nader Omar, leaders of the security services, a large number of heads and members of local authorities, representatives of diplomatic missions, representatives of civil society organizations and dozens of participants in the oil and olive festival products market , And A significant tightening of the people of the city and the province. Agriculture Minister Riyad al-Attari said that olives have become a password for our people because of their national symbolism, high economic value and their role in food security. He expected the production of 30 thousand tons this season compared to 14 tons and a half last season, which means the possibility of exporting 6 Al-Attari, who conveyed the prime minister's greetings, said that the government had drafted the first draft of the Bethlehem Declaration as a tourist cluster, which would include all parts of the governorate, which would enhance its status, and encourage Revitalizing her tourism, confirms its position d The governor of Bethlehem, Major General Kamel Hameed, said that the festival is in line with the government's orientation and its launch as a tourist cluster will eventually finance its industries and support its economy. He hopes that oil and olives will not be bought or imported to support farmers and give them the ability to cope. Difficult economic conditions, and face settlement expansion. Hameed praised the Lutheran Church and the Center for Environmental Education, who perform a national and environmental mission, aimed at protecting the land and building the human in the environmental, national and educational aspects. Resilience of farmers, protecting their product and resources. The olive harvest is a joyous season that decorates the lives of Palestinians. This tree occupies a high place in the conscience of farmers and people, and represents a cultural heritage and social value associated with the history and civilization of the region, but the olive harvest season, as in previous years, overlooks sad and blatant sadness. Receives from the attacks of the settlers and the brutal occupation army .. They target and burn in an attempt to rewrite history and eliminate the symbol of our Palestinian existence. The festival today also coincides with the fateful Balfour Declaration, in which Britain gave a foreign body the legitimacy of usurping the land of fathers and grandfathers. It gave the land of Palestine, which it does not own, to the unworthy. The Zionists forcibly replaced the Palestinian people and enabled them to seize all our resources and geography, thus creating the worst. A racist regime in the history of mankind, an abhorrent occupation that kills and destroys and makes the life of the Palestinians a difficult reality. Hanania went to salute the deportees of the Church of the Nativity and wished that they would return to participate in the olive harvest in Palestine. He said that we do not forget the thousands of dunums of Bethlehem lands that were confiscated by the occupation, surrounded by the apartheid wall, and reiterated the stability next to the Lady of the foothills, as the poet Mahmoud Darwish called it. Ezer, the blessed olive tree mentioned in the Bible and the Holy Scriptures, is the symbol of suffering because Christ suffered on the Mount of Olives, and because today it is threatened with uprooting, and seeks the lost peace that symbolizes it. Attention, make what we can Care to support farmers, and we will announce the next Olive Festival, which coincides with Bethlehem's capitalHe urged the committee sponsoring the celebrations of Bethlehem as the capital of Arab culture 2020 to adopt the largest jar in the Nativity Square, because of the significance of this jar and the link to the land and revival. The Center's Executive Director, Simon Awad, stressed that the festival renewed its support for farmers and revived the initiative of a tree for each student, announced in 2006, and sought to greening Palestine by focusing on planting olives and native trees. The 20th edition of the festival will coincide next year with the celebration of Bethlehem as the capital of Arab culture 2020, and will seek to spread its activities in the governorates of the homeland, and support larger segments of the farmers. For the first time, because it is the festival of the earth, a dose of hope and support for the peasants, and contributes to the protection of our identity, in the face of fierce settlement seeks to uproot our olives and rob us of our heritage, and also convey to tourists the message of our people's insistence on life. Several months plowing, which adhere to our practices Zarra Ahmed Ghoneim, a member of the Farmers' Association of Agricultural Relief, explained that the festival's message is renewed every year and provides an opportunity for direct support to farmers and the marketing of their oil and tree-related products. About 40 developmental and community-based organizations promoted oil and olive products, exhibited handicrafts, oil-related industries, and traditional products for women's, developmental and rural associations, and exhibited drawings for university students participating in the plastic art competition (Olive Tree of Heaven), which was implemented in partnership with the Ministry of Higher Education. The festival included artistic passages and heritage networks for schools in Bethlehem, Ramallah and Al-Bireh, musical performances by the Bethlehem Academy of Music, while the storytelling group "Haki Al-Qraya" presented a traditional speech by Nabil Alqam, a popular network for Al-Baidar band, and traditional songs for the women's group in the group. , Poems, heritage fashion shows for the Evangelical Lutheran School in Bethlehem, Hedaya and Zajal passage for the popular Hedaya band, and popular performances and dabka for the Jafra Ensemble.
